channel.title: Finance on Columbia DSI Scholars
channel.description: Recent content in Finance on Columbia DSI Scholars

item.title: Efficient representations and prediction of multidimensional time series data
item.description: Big data with temporal dependence brings unique challenges in effective prediction and data analysis. The complex high-dimensional interactions between observations in such data brings unique challenges which standard off-the-shelf machine learning algorithms cannot handle. Even basic tasks of clustering, visualization and identification of recurring patterns are difficult.

item.title: Data For Good Project: The Cost of Human Rights Violations
item.description: Under United States securities laws corporations must disclose material risks to their operations. Human rights issues, especially in authoritarian countries, rarely show up in the information that data providers offer to investors, in part due to the risks to those subject to these abuses. The result is a dearth of data on human rights materiality and the tendency of investors to overlook human rights risks of the companies that they finance.
